node.title: Fake meat inquiry may ask vegan food producers to drop labels like 'beef' from packaging
node.description: Plant-based food producers may be forced to drop terms including 'beef' and 'sausage' — as well as any images of animals — from their packaging, according to the chair of a Senate inquiry into food labelling.
node.content:
["Plant-based food producers could soon be forced to drop terms including 'beef' and\u00a0'sausage' \u2014\u00a0as well as any images of animals \u2014\u00a0from their packaging, according to the chair of a Senate inquiry into food labelling.", "The inquiry \u2013 initiated by Queensland Nationals senator and former butcher Susan McDonald \u2014 is examining whether plant-based product manufacturers should be able to use words associated with animals on their packaging, and if consumers are being misled about what they are buying because of the labelling on plant-based foods.", "Australia's consumer watchdog, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC), said\u00a0it had\u00a0no evidence that consumers were being misled, but Senator McDonald said the inquiry had\u00a0received anecdotal stories that some people were confused.", "She told ABC News the inquiry's\u00a0final report in February would\u00a0likely recommend changes to where plant-based foods were located on supermarket shelves and how they were labelled.", "", "
Nationals senator and former butcher Susan McDonald\u00a0is examining whether plant-based product manufacturers should be able to use words associated with animals on their packaging.\u00a0(Chloe Chomicki.)
", "\"The second is about the labelling \u2014 that we don't use the picture of an animal, we don't use the name of an animal, on a product that has no reference to that animal at all.\"", "But without firm evidence that consumers are being misled, the plant-based food industry is asking:\u00a0why even hold an inquiry or recommend changes?", "", "
Australia's regulator the ACCC and retailers say there is no firm\u00a0evidence that consumers are being misled and most\u00a0understand the difference between real meat and fake meat.(Foreign Correspondent)
", "
Meat consumption remains high
", "To consider that question, it's important to look at the context of changing consumer food preferences.", "It's well-known that Australia has long been a nation of meat lovers.", "Per capita, our meat consumption remains one of the highest in the world.", "But consumers are increasingly considering ethically and environmentally conscious dietary habits, and food consumption is changing.", "It's part of the reason why domestic consumption of meat has fallen to its lowest point since the mid-1990s (drought conditions impacting livestock and prices are another reason).", "IBISWorld data estimates meat consumption in 2020-21 at 99.5 kilograms per capita (per person) per year.", "It forecasts this will lift by just 0.3 per cent in 2021-22 to 99.8 kilograms per capita (per person) per year.", "While that's still high by global standards, it's near its lowest point since 1996-97.", "At the same time, more consumers are purchasing plant-based products.", "", "
Retail sales of plant-based foods lifted 46 per cent in 2019-20 to $154 million.\n\u00a0(John Gunn.)
", "According to a report by Food Frontier \u2013 which says its mission is to help \"understand the emergence of plant-based meats\" and \"unlock the economic, environmental, and public health benefits they offer\" \u2014 grocery retail sales of plant-based foods are rising.", "Retail sales of plant-based foods lifted 46 per cent in 2019-20 to $154 million.", "The Food Frontier report said\u00a0global expenditure on plant-based meats was estimated to reach up to US$140 billion by 2029.", "It cited\u00a0Deloitte Access Economics modelling that, if Australia's plant-based food industry experiences moderate growth, the sector would generate almost $3 billion in retail sales by 2030, over $1 billion in manufacturing and would employ more than 6,000 Australians.", "In most major supermarkets there are\u00a0now several varieties of plant-based food alternatives to meat and dairy lining supermarket shelves.", "", "
Australia's plant-based food industry is expected to generate almost $3 billion in retail sales by 2030.(John Gunn.)
", "
Living a 'cruelty-free life'
", "That range of alternatives made it easy for Elizabeth Sherry to give up meat seven years ago and move to a vegan food diet.", "\"I want to live a cruelty-free life,\" she said, explaining her decision.", "\"I want to have as minimal impact on the environment as possible.\"", "", "
Elizabeth Sherry turned to a vegan food diet seven years ago and never looked back.(ABC News.)
", "She said\u00a0she found\u00a0plant-based food alternatives were clearly labelled and thought it was fine to use terms like 'meat-free' or 'meat-alternative'.", "But she would prefer they be located further away from the meat on supermarket shelves.", "\"I find that the mock meats or the vegan meats are placed amongst animal meat, and I have no interest in having anything to do with dead animals,\" she said.", "\"I would prefer to have it in a different spot. But for me, it's very clear when I go and buy it, what I'm purchasing.", "Ms Sherry feared\u00a0that naming it something else would be confusing for consumers.", "\"People know when they're buying a steak that it's a steak and I think that they know if they're buying a vegan sausage.\"", "", "
Meat-free sausages are\u00a0sold at Australian supermarkets.(John Gunn.)
", "
'Don't piggyback off our brand'
", "But the meat industry said\u00a0any food manufacturer that wasn't selling animal protein\u00a0shouldn't trade off their product name.", "The Australian Meat Industry Council has called for an overhaul of the Food Standards Code, and development of a new mandatory standard for the plant-based food industry.", "The council's general manager for processing and export, Mary Wu, said\u00a0the meat industry wanted\u00a0the federal government to stop the plant-based food industry from being able to \"piggyback\" off meat branding, while also \"denigrating\" meat products.", "", "
The Australian Meat Industry Council's Mary Wu says plant-based producers should not use terms like 'beef'.(Nick Haggarty.)
", "She said\u00a0the meat industry had\u00a0invested almost $7 billion in 25 years on branding and wanted\u00a0words like beef, lamb, goat, sheep, pig and images of animals removed off plant-based food labels.", "\"We don't want to see any of that kind of misappropriation of our category, our branding,\" Dr\u00a0Wu said.", "\"The plant-based industry want to freely use different terminology like 'beef' and 'sheep' and 'pork' and 'lamb', without having any degree of responsibility over the use of that terminology.", "\"We have invested over decades. And then at the same time, they [plant-based food manufacturers] then try to say that our industry is not green enough; that we're destroying the environment by growing cows and sheep and any kind of livestock, which is absolutely not true.\"", "", "
Food manufacturers like Impossible Foods try to mimic real meat in their adevrtising, which has angered the meat industry.\u00a0(Supplied.\u00a0)
", "
Plant-based food industry says changing product labels will cause chaos
", "Silicon Valley-based company Impossible Foods is one of the world's biggest plant-based food producers and supplies Australian supermarkets and fast-food chains, including Grill'd.", "Impossible Foods' vice-president of government relations, Tyler Jameson, says it markets its\u00a0products on the fact that it's much like real beef because that's what consumers know and want mimicked if they are ditching meat for environmental or other reasons.", "", "
Impossible Food VP of government relations Tyler Jameson says consumers understand the difference between real meat and fake meat.(Supplied.\u00a0)
", "\"There's no consumer confusion using terms like beef, or chicken or pork,\" he said.", "\"And we are not trying to confuse anyone, we're just making it very clear that our product is a beef-like product.", "\"If there were a problem, we would be the first ones to make changes, because we have every incentive to make sure consumers understand what our product is and what it isn't.\"", "", "Mr Jameson said\u00a0several state\u00a0governments in the United States have tried to slap restrictions on plant-based food labelling and failed, but there were some European countries that have introduced regulations.", "He said\u00a0if Australia goes down the path of changing food labelling, it would\u00a0confuse consumers and be costly for the industry.", "\"In the long-term, it's going to cause chaos in the marketplace,\" he said.", "No Meat May co-founder Ryan Alexander said\u00a0the inquiry was not fixing a problem but seeking to protect the meat industry from losing market share.", "", "
No Meat May co-founder Ryan Alexander says\u00a0there are already laws and regulations to prevent plant-based producers from misleading consumers with labelling.(John Gunn.)
", "\"The Senate inquiry has been instigated and shaped by industries and people that have a financial interest in the meat industry,\" he said.", "Mr Alexander said\u00a0if there were rare instances of manufacturers confusing people with their labelling, there were already mechanisms in place to address that.", "\"We have a consumer watchdog, we have a governance framework in place, we have legislation in place,\" he said.", "\"If someone is overstepping the line \u2026 let's put them through that mechanism and hold them to account.\"", "But he said\u00a0most Australians know the difference between real meat and plant-based meat.", "\"There is no confusion because you know, we can read labels and Australians aren't stupid,\" Mr Alexander said.", "Big retailers also argued that most consumers know what they were purchasing.", "In its written submission, Woolworths said\u00a0that only 7 per cent of almost 6,000 customers surveyed had mistakenly purchased a plant-based product.", "Mr Alexander said\u00a0any case for sweeping changes\u00a0needed\u00a0to be backed by real evidence rather than anecdotal stories from the meat industry.", "", "
Supermarket giant Woolworths said that only 7 per cent of almost 6,000 customers surveyed had mistakenly purchased a plant-based product at its stores.(John Gunn.)
", "
Senator says it's hard to get firm evidence
", "Senator McDonald said\u00a0it was hard to get firm evidence because consumers rarely report mistaken purchases.", "She said\u00a0if people buy a product in error because they are in a rush at the supermarket, or do not understand the labelling, they are unlikely to make a complaint to the ACCC for a product that costs a few dollars.", "\"English might not be their first language, they're elderly, they have sight problems, there's a whole range of reasons why it's really important that product labelling be clear and be accurate.\"", "Senator McDonald said\u00a0the big supermarket retailers did not front the hearings after making written submissions.", "", "
Senator Susan McDonald says she's worried some vegan-food producers are on a mission to reduce meat consumption.\u00a0(Chloe Chomicki.)
", "She accused\u00a0the retailers of having a \"vested interest\" because they were selling shelf space to big plant-based food manufacturers.", "\"But privately they do tell me that they're removing products that they believe mislead customers,\" she said.", "Senator McDonald acknowledged\u00a0there was a need for alternative proteins to animal meat amidst the growing global population.", "\"What I am concerned about though, is some of the plant-based protein manufacturers are \u2026 through their business mission statements saying that their purpose is to reduce the consumption of animal products,\" she said.", "The inquiry will hand down its findings in February, and while Senator McDonald has indicated what recommendations she would like to see, it is possible there will be\u00a0a dissenting report from other senators such as the Greens."]
